page.title: 17 Transport on the A5
page.content: The A5 travels from London to Holyhead.It is partly dual and partly single carriageway. The A5 is a very busy road because people use it to get to work. There are pavements both sides of the road. Four out of five drivers are men. Out of all the cars the Ford Cortina was the most popular make. The 'U' (1979\80) registration was most common. The oldest registration was a car registered 'D' (1965\66). On average a car passed every 6 seconds. there were 281 cars. Of all the lorries passing, most were carrying building material. Tamworth is a growing town.
